worms.model
Class Worm

java.lang.Object
  worms.model.GameObject
      worms.model.Worm

public class Worm
extends GameObject

A class of worms for the game 'Worms'.

Version:
2.0
Author:
Victor Le Pochat, Emil Loevbak
Invariants:
  • radius must contain a legal value as per isValidRadius().
        isValidRadius(this.getRadius())
  • orientation must contain a legal value as per isValidOrientation().
        isValidOrientation(this.getOrientation())
  • actionPoints must contain a legal value as per isValidActionPoints().
        isValidActionPoints(this.getActionPoints())
  • name must contain a legal value as per isValidName().
        isValidName(this.getName())

    Field Detail

    DENSITY

    public static final int DENSITY
    Constant reflecting the homogeneous density of a worm. The homogeneous density of a worm is 1062 kg/m³.

    See Also:
    Constant Field Values
    Constructor Detail

    Worm

    @Raw
public Worm(World world,
                double x,
                double y,
                double orientation,
                double radius,
                java.lang.String name)
     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
    Creates a worm and initializes it with the provided parameters.

    Parameters:
    x - The starting x-coordinate of the worm.
    y - The starting y-coordinate of the worm.
    orientation - The starting angle of the worm.
    radius - The radius of the circle describing the space taken up by the worm.
    name - The worms name.
    Effects:
  • x will be stored in new.x
        this.setX(x)
  • y will be stored in new.y
        this.setY(y)
  • orientation will be stored in new.orientation
        this.setOrientation(orientation)
  • new.actionPoints will be set to the result returned by getMaxActionPoints().
        this.setActionPoints(getMaxActionPoints())
  • new.hitPoints will be set to the result returned by getMaxHitPoints().
        this.setHitPoints(getMaxHitPoints())
  • radius will be stored in new.radius.
        this.setRadius(radius)
  • name will be stored in new.name.
        this.setName(name)
    • Throws:
    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

    Worm

    @Raw
public Worm(World world)
    A default constructor for creating a worm.

    Effect:
    The worm is initialized at (0.0,0.0), facing right, with a minimal radius and the name "BOB". Worm(0.0, 0.0, 0.0, getMinimalRadius(), "New Worm")
    Method Detail

    canMove

    public boolean canMove()
    Checks whether the worm can perform a given move operation.

    Parameters:
    nbSteps - The number of steps involved in the move operation.
    Returns:
    True if the worm has enough action points for the move operation. False if this is not the case.
        if this.getActionPoints() >= this.calculateMoveActionPoints(nbSteps)
         result == true
        else
         result == false

    move

    public void move()
    Moves the worm to another location adjacent to impassable terrain, following the slope of that terrain in the direction of this worm.

    Postconditions:

  •     isAdjacent(new.getPosition().getX(),new.getPosition().getY(),   new.getRadius()) == true

  •     new.distance(this) <= this.getRadius()

  •     for all (double divergence = -0.7875; divergence <= 0.7875; divergence += 0.0175)

    • fall

    public void fall()
    Makes the worm do a passive fall.

    canFall

    public boolean canFall()

    canTurn

    public boolean canTurn(double angle)
    Checks whether the worm can perform a given turn operation.

    Parameters:
    angle - The angle of the move operation.
    Returns:
    True if the worm has enough action points for the turn operation. False if this is not the case.
        if this.getActionPoints() >= this.calculateTurnActionPoints(angle)
         result == true
        else
         result == false

    turn

    public void turn(double angle)
    Rotates the worm over the given angle.

    Parameters:
    angle - The angle over which to rotate the worm.
    Effects:
  • The worm's orientation will be changed by the provided angle.
        this.setOrientation(this.getOrientation() + angle)
  • The worm's action points, required for the turn operation, will be subtracted from the worm.
        this.setActionPoints(this.getActionPoints() - calculateTurnActionPoints(angle))

    • getOrientation

    @Basic
@Raw
public double getOrientation()
    Return the orientation of this worm.

    isValidOrientation

    public static boolean isValidOrientation(double orientation)
    Check whether the given orientation is a valid orientation for any worm.

    Parameters:
    orientation - The orientation to check.
    Returns:
    True if and only if the given orientation is between -2*Pi and 2*Pi.
        result == orientation >= -2.0*Math.PI &&
         orientation <= 2.0*Math.PI

    isValidRadius

    public static boolean isValidRadius(double radius)
    Check whether the given radius is a valid radius for any worm.

    Parameters:
    radius - The radius to check.
    Returns:
    True if and only if the given radius is bigger than the minimal radius and the radius has a valid value for a GameObject.
        result == (radius >= getMinimalRadius()) && GameObject.isValidRadius(radius);

    setRadius

    @Raw
public void setRadius(double radius)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
    Set the radius of this worm to the given radius.

    Overrides:
    setRadius in class GameObject
    Parameters:
    radius - The new radius for this worm.
    Effect:
    The new number of action points of this worm will not be larger than the new maximum number of action points.
        this.setActionPoints(getMaxActionPoints())
    Postcondition:
    The new radius of this worm is equal to the given radius.
        new.getRadius() == radius
    Throws:
    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - [CAN] The given radius is not a valid radius for this worm.

    getMinimalRadius

    @Basic
@Immutable
public static double getMinimalRadius()
    Return the minimal radius of a worm.

    getActionPoints

    @Basic
@Raw
public int getActionPoints()
    Return the number of action points of this worm.

    getMaxActionPoints

    public int getMaxActionPoints()
    Return the maximum amount of action points of this worm.

    Returns:
    The maximum number of action points of a worm is equal to the worm's mass, rounded to the nearest integer.
        result == (int) Math.round(getMass())

    getHitPoints

    @Basic
@Raw
public int getHitPoints()
    Return the number of hit points of this worm.

    getMaxHitPoints

    public int getMaxHitPoints()
    Return the maximum amount of hit points of this worm.

    Returns:
    The maximum number of hit points of a worm is equal to the worm's mass, rounded to the nearest integer.
        result == (int) Math.round(getMass())

    getName

    @Basic
@Raw
public java.lang.String getName()
    Return the name of this worm.

    isValidName

    public static boolean isValidName(java.lang.String name)
    Check whether the given name is a valid name for any worm.

    Parameters:
    name - The name to check.
    Returns:
    False if the given name is not effective.
        if (name == null)
         then result == false   Otherwise, true if the given name begins with   exactly one uppercase letter followed by at least one   letter (both uppercase and lowercase),   quote (both single and double) and/or space.
        else if (name.matches("^[A-Z][A-Za-z \'\"]+")
         result == true

    setName

    @Raw
public void setName(java.lang.String name)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
    Set the name of this worm to the given name.

    Parameters:
    name - The new name for this worm.
    Postcondition:
    The new name of worm is equal to the given name.
        new.getName() == name
    Throws:
    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - [CAN] The given name is not a valid name for any worm.
        ! isValidName (name)

    getMass

    public double getMass()
    Return the mass of this worm.

    Returns:
    The mass of this worm, assuming that the worm has a spherical body and a homogeneous density.
        DENSITY*(4.0/3.0)*Math.PI*Math.pow(getRadius(),3)
